OptionChoice.name: enableInexOreGen
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle InexOreGen ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle InexOreGen ores.
InexOreGen ores will be handled by Minecraft directly.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpInexOreGen
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of InexOreGen ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up InexOreGen ores.
InexOreGen ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Coal is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for InexOreGen Coal distributions
